Judy's Turn to Cry" is a song written by Beverly Ross and Edna Lewis that was 
originally released by Lesley Gore in 1963. The song was produced by Quincy 
Jones, who also produced Gore's prior hit "It's My Party". It was released on 
Gore's first album I'll Cry If I Want To and also as a single ... The sequel, "Judy's 
Turn to Cry," was recorded on May 14, 1963.
